text.sentence: Yes, I had already approved them for trading without any restrictions.
When I got the signed master in, it just meant that the confirmations now took a different path.

Something that yall will find helpful... I've been working with the Lotus Notes people in upgrading our current Master Swap Agreement database, and once its finalized we will be opening view access to anyone who wants it.

I am adding drop downs for "approved for online trading", so you will be able to confirm our approval, als, contract information which is currently provided on a monthly basis will now be available at all times.

I think other groups that rely on our contract information, Credit, Settlements, Global Contracts, EOL, dealmakers, or anyone else (at ECT or ECT Canada for confidentiality purposes) will now be able to be seeing what we're seeing in terms of the financial contacts.
I was told my prototype would be done by the end of the week, and then we'll have to test it, but hopefully this information will be available soon.
